title: H2O Purépechas F.C.
text:
The H2O Purépechas Fútbol Club is a Mexican <a href="football%20%28soccer%29">football</a> club based in <a href="Morelia">Morelia</a>. The club was founded on 25 July 2021, and currently plays in the <a href="Liga%20TDP">Liga TDP</a>.
History.
The team has its origins in the Club Deportivo H2O, which is an amateur team managed by the Morelia water and sewerage management body. 
In August 2021, an agreement was reached between the sports club, the Axon Capital company and <a href="Atl%C3%A9tico%20Morelia">Atlético Morelia</a> to register the team in the <a href="Liga%20TDP">Liga TDP</a>, the fourth category of Mexican football. The team is managed by the financial company, but most of the players come from Atlético Morelia youth teams, since H2O Purépechas F.C. is the reserve team.
The team officially debuted on September 25, 2021, defeating Atlético Chavinda 2–0. 
In October 2021, the team began playing its home matches at <a href="Estadio%20Venustiano%20Carranza">Estadio Venustiano Carranza</a>, after having played its first matches at a local sports complex.
Stadium.
<a href="Estadio%20Venustiano%20Carranza">Estadio Venustiano Carranza</a> is a multi-use <a href="stadium">stadium</a> in <a href="Morelia">Morelia</a>, <a href="Mexico">Mexico</a>, used mostly for football matches and athletics. It was initially used as the home stadium of <a href="Monarcas%20Morelia">Monarcas Morelia</a>. It was replaced by <a href="Estadio%20Morelos">Estadio Morelos</a> when Monarcas Morelia moved in 1989. It is currently used by H2O Purépechas F.C., a <a href="Liga%20TDP">Liga TDP</a> team. The stadium capacity is 17,600 spectators.
